fr: Le ciel etait une coupe renversee de metal bleu.

eng: A thin film of ice bordered the flat, reed-grown lake.
fr: Une legere couche de glace bordait la surface unie du lac entoure de roseaux...

eng: At the corner of the pine-wood he caught sight of Sir Geoffrey Clouston, the duchess's brother, jerking two spent cartridges out of his gun.
fr: Au coin d'un bois de sapins, il apercut sir Geoffrey Clouston, le frere de la duchesse, extrayant de son fusil deux cartouches tirees.

eng: "Good heavens! I have hit a beater!"
fr: "-- Mon Dieu ! J'ai atteint un rabatteur, s'exclama sir Geoffrey."

eng: "What an ass the man was to get in front of the guns!"
fr: "Quel ane, que cet homme qui se met devant les fusils !"

eng: "Stop shooting there!"
fr: "Cessez de tirer ! cria-t-il de toute la force de ses poumons."

eng: "The whole thing is hideous and cruel.
fr: 'Cette chose est odieuse et cruelle.

eng: "Is the man ...?"
fr: Est-ce que cet homme est...

eng: He could not finish the sentence.
fr: Il ne put achever...

eng: "I am afraid so," rejoined Lord Henry.
fr: -- Je le crains, repliqua lord Henry.

eng: "He got the whole charge of shot in his chest.'
fr: Il a recu la charge entiere dans la poitrine.'

eng: Then Dorian looked at Lord Henry and said, with a heavy sigh, "It is a bad omen, Harry, a very bad omen."
fr: Enfin Dorian se tourna vers lord Henry et lui dit avec un soupir profond : -- C'est un mauvais presage, Harry, un bien mauvais presage !

eng: "What is?" asked Lord Henry.
fr: -- Quoi donc ? interrogea lord Henry...

eng: "Oh! this accident, I suppose."
fr: Ah ! cet accident, je crois.

eng: "But there is no use talking about the matter."
fr: 'Mais pourquoi parler de cela?...'

eng: "Dorian shook his head."
fr: 'Dorian secoua la tete :'

eng: "It is a bad omen, Harry."
fr: '-- Mauvais presage, Harry !... '

eng: "I feel as if something horrible were going to happen to some of us. To myself, perhaps,"
fr: 'J'ai idee qu'il va arriver quelque chose de terrible a l'un d'entre nous... A moi, peut-etre...'

eng: "he added, passing his hand over his eyes, with a gesture of pain."
fr: 'Il se passa la main sur les yeux, avec un geste douloureux...'

eng: "The elder man laughed."
fr: 'Lord Henry eclata de rire...'

eng: "The only horrible thing in the world is _ennui_, Dorian."
fr: '-- La seule chose terrible au monde est l'ennui, Dorian.'

eng: "That is the one sin for which there is no forgiveness."
fr: 'C'est le seul peche pour lequel il n'existe pas de pardon...'

eng: "But we are not likely to suffer from it unless these fellows keep chattering about this thing at dinner."
fr: 'Mais probablement, cette affaire ne nous amenera pas de desagrements, a moins que les rabatteurs n'en bavardent en dinant ;'

eng: "I must tell them that the subject is to be tabooed."
fr: 'je leur defendrai d'en parler...'

eng: "As for omens, there is no such thing as an omen."
fr: 'Quant aux presages, ca n'existe pas :'

eng: "Destiny does not send us heralds."
fr: 'la destinee ne nous envoie pas de herauts ;'

eng: "She is too wise or too cruel for that."
fr: 'elle est trop sage... ou trop cruelle pour cela.'

eng: You have everything in the world that a man can want.
fr: Vous avez tout ce que dans le monde un homme peut desirer.

eng: There is no one who would not be delighted to change places with you.
fr: Quel est celui qui ne voudrait changer son existence contre la votre ?...

eng: There is no one with whom I would not change places, Harry.
fr: Il n'est personne avec qui je ne la changerais, Harry...

eng: Don't laugh like that.
fr: Ne riez pas !...

eng: I am telling you the truth.
fr: Je dis vrai...

eng: The wretched peasant who has just died is better off than I am.
fr: Le miserable paysan qui vient de mourir est plus heureux que moi.

eng: "Good heavens! don't you see a man moving behind the trees there, watching me, waiting for me?"
fr: "Mon Dieu ! Ne voyez-vous pas, derriere ces arbres, un homme qui me guette, qui m'attend !..."

eng: "Lord Henry looked in the direction in which the trembling gloved hand was pointing."
fr: "Lord Henry regarda dans la direction que lui indiquait la tremblante main gantee..."

eng: ""Yes," he said, smiling, "I see the gardener waiting for you."
fr: "-- Oui, dit-il en riant... Je vois le jardinier qui vous attend."

eng: "I suppose he wants to ask you what flowers you wish to have on the table to-night."
fr: "Je m'imagine qu'il a besoin de savoir quelles sont les fleurs que vous voulez mettre sur la table, ce soir..."

eng: "How absurdly nervous you are, my dear fellow!"
fr: "Vous etes vraiment nerveux, mon cher !"

eng: In the present instance, you are quite astray.
fr: Ainsi, en ce moment, vous vous egarez.

eng: I like the duchess very much, but I don t love her.
fr: J'estime beaucoup la duchesse, mais je ne l'aime pas.

eng: "And the duchess loves you very much, but she likes you less, so you are excellently matched.
fr: -- Et la duchesse vous aime beaucoup, mais elle vous estime moins, ce qui fait que vous etes parfaitement apparies.

eng: "You would sacrifice anybody, Harry, for the sake of an epigram."
fr: '-- Vous sacrifiez n'importe qui, Harry, pour l'amour d'un epigramme.'

eng: "The world goes to the altar of its own accord," was the answer.
fr: '-- Les gens vont a l'autel de leur propre consentement, fut la reponse.'

eng: "I wish I could love," cried Dorian Gray with a deep note of pathos in his voice.
fr: '-- Je voudrais aimer ! s'ecria Dorian Gray avec une intonation profondement pathetique dans la voix.'

eng: "But I seem to have lost the passion and forgotten the desire. I am too much concentrated on myself. My own personality has become a burden to me. I want to escape, to go away, to forget."
fr: 'Mais il me semble que j'ai perdu la passion et oublie le desir. Je suis trop concentre en moi-meme. Ma personnalite m'est devenue un fardeau, j'ai besoin de m'evader, de voyager, d'oublier.'

eng: "What nonsense!"
fr: "-- Quelle folie !"

eng: "I hope it is, but I can't help feeling it."
fr: "-- Je l'espere... mais je ne puis m'empecher d'y penser..."

eng: "Ah! here is the duchess, looking like Artemis in a tailor-made gown."
fr: "Ah ! voici la duchesse, elle a l'air d'Arthemise dans un costume tailleur..."

eng: "You see we have come back, Duchess."
fr: "Vous voyez que nous revenions, duchesse..."

eng: "I have heard all about it, Mr. Gray,"
fr: "-- J'ai appris ce qui est arrive, M. Gray, repondit-elle."

eng: "Poor Geoffrey is terribly upset."
fr: "Ce pauvre Geoffrey est tout a fait contrarie..."

eng: Some whim, I suppose.
fr: Quelque caprice, je crois ;

eng: It looked the loveliest of little live things.
fr: ce lievre avait l'air de la plus jolie des choses vivantes...

eng: But I am sorry they told you about the man.
fr: Mais je suis fache qu'on vous ait rapporte l'accident.

eng: It is a hideous subject.
fr: C'est un odieux sujet...

eng: "It is an annoying subject," broke in Lord Henry.
fr: C'est un sujet ennuyant, interrompit lord Henry.

eng: "It has no psychological value at all."
fr: Il n'a aucune valeur psychologique.

eng: "I should like to know some one who had committed a real murder."
fr: "J'aimerais connaitre quelqu'un qui eut commis un vrai meurtre."

eng: "How horrid of you, Harry!"
fr: "Que c'est mal a vous de parler ainsi, cria la duchesse."

eng: "Isn t it, Mr. Gray?"
fr: "N'est-ce pas, M. Gray?..."

eng: "Harry, Mr. Gray is ill again."
fr: "Harry !... M. Gray est encore indispose !..."

eng: "It is nothing, Duchess," he murmured; "my nerves are dreadfully out of order.
fr: '-- Ce n'est rien, duchesse, murmura-t-il, mes nerfs sont surexcites ;

eng: That is all.
fr: c'est tout...

eng: I am afraid I walked too far this morning.
fr: Je crains de ne pouvoir aller loin ce matin.

eng: I didn't hear what Harry said.
fr: Je n'ai pas entendu ce qu'Harry disait...

eng: Was it very bad?
fr: Etait-ce mal ?

eng: You must tell me some other time.
fr: Vous me le direz une autre fois.

eng: I think I must go and lie down.
fr: Je pense qu'il vaut mieux que j'aille me coucher.'

eng: "All ways end at the same point, my dear Gladys."
fr: "-- Tous les chemins menent au meme point, ma chere Gladys."

eng: "What is that?"
fr: "-- Quel est-il ?"

eng: "Disillusion."
fr: "-- La desillusion."

eng: "It was my _d but_ in life," she sighed.
fr: "-- C'est mon debut dans la vie, soupira-t-elle."

eng: "It came to you crowned."
fr: "-- Il vous vint couronne..."

eng: "I am tired of strawberry leaves."
fr: "-- Je suis fatigue des feuilles de fraisier."

eng: "They become you."
fr: "-- Elles vous vont bien."

eng: "Only in public."
fr: "-- Seulement en public..."

eng: "You would miss them," said Lord Henry.
fr: "-- Vous les regretterez."

eng: "I will not part with a petal."
fr: "-- Je n'en perdrai pas un petale."

eng: "Monmouth has ears."
fr: "-- Monmouth a des oreilles."

eng: "Old age is dull of hearing."
fr: "-- La vieillesse est dure d'oreille."

eng: "Has he never been jealous?"
fr: "-- N'a-t-il jamais ete jaloux ?"

eng: "I wish he had been."
fr: "-- Je voudrais qu'il l'eut ete."

eng: He glanced about as if in search of something.
fr: Il regarda autour de lui comme cherchant quelque chose...

eng: "What are you looking for?" she inquired.
fr: "-- Que cherchez-vous ? demanda-t-elle."

eng: "The button from your foil," he answered.
fr: "-- La mouche de votre fleuret, repondit-il..."

eng: "You have dropped it."
fr: "-- Vous l'avez laissee tomber."

eng: "I have still the mask."
fr: "-- J'ai encore le masque, dit-elle en riant."

eng: "It makes your eyes lovelier," was his reply.
fr: "-- Il fait vos yeux plus adorables !"

eng: She laughed again. Her teeth showed like white seeds in a scarlet fruit.
fr: Elle rit a nouveau. Ses dents apparurent, tels de blancs pepins dans un fruit ecarlate...

eng: Upstairs, in his own room, Dorian Gray was lying on a sofa, with terror in every tingling fibre of his body. Life had suddenly become too hideous a burden for him to bear. The dreadful death of the unlucky beater, shot in the thicket like a wild animal, had seemed to him to pre-figure death for himself also.
fr: La-haut, dans sa chambre, Dorian Gray gisait sur un sofa, la terreur dans chaque fibre frissonnante de son corps. La vie lui etait devenue subitement un fardeau trop lourd a porter. La mort terrible du rabatteur infortune, tue dans le fourre comme un fauve, lui semblait prefigurer sa mort.

eng: "Was the poor fellow married?"
fr: "-- Est-ce que le pauvre garcon etait marie ?"

eng: "Had he any people dependent on him?"
fr: "Avait-il de la famille ?"

eng: "asked Dorian, looking bored."
fr: "demanda Dorian d'un air ennuye'."

eng: "We don't know who he is, sir. That is what I took the liberty of coming to you about."
fr: '-- Nous ne savons qui il est, monsieur. C'est pourquoi j'ai pris la liberte de venir vous voir.'

eng: "Don't know who he is?"
fr: 'Vous ne savez qui il est,'

eng: said Dorian, listlessly.
fr: 'dit Dorian insoucieusement ;'

eng: "What do you mean? Wasn't he one of your men?"
fr: 'que voulez-vous dire ? N'etait-il pas un de vos hommes ?...'

eng: "No, sir. Never saw him before. Seems like a sailor, sir."
fr: '-- Non, monsieur ; personne ne l'avait jamais vu ; il a l'air d'un marin.'

eng: "Yes, sir. He looks as if he had been a sort of sailor; tattooed on both arms, and that kind of thing."
fr: "-- Oui, monsieur... Il a vraiment l'air de quelqu'un qui a servi dans la marine. Il est tatoue aux deux bras, notamment."

eng: "Was there anything found on him?" said Dorian, leaning forward and looking at the man with startled eyes. "Anything that would tell his name?"
fr: "A-t-on trouve quelque chose sur lui, dit Dorian en se penchant vers l'homme et le regardant fixement. Quelque chose faisant connaitre son nom...?"

eng: A decent-looking man, sir, but rough-like.
fr: L'apparence convenable, mais grossiere.

eng: A sort of sailor we think.
fr: Une sorte de matelot, croyons-nous...

eng: Dorian started to his feet.
fr: Dorian bondit sur ses pieds...

eng: A terrible hope fluttered past him.
fr: Une esperance terrible le traversa...

eng: 'he exclaimed. "Quick! I must see it at once."'
fr: 's'ecria-t-il. Vite, je veux le voir !'

eng: "They say a corpse brings bad luck."
fr: "Ils disent qu'un cadavre apporte le malheur."

eng: "The Home Farm! Go there at once and meet me."
fr: "La maison de ferme... Allez m'y attendre."

eng: "Tell one of the grooms to bring my horse round."
fr: "Dites a un palefrenier de m'amener un cheval..."

eng: "No."
fr: "Non,"

eng: "Never mind."
fr: "n'en faites rien..."

eng: "It will save time."
fr: 'Ca economisera du temps.'

eng: "In less than a quarter of an hour, Dorian Gray was galloping down the long avenue as hard as he could go."
fr: 'Moins d'un quart d'heure apres, Dorian Gray descendit au grand galop la longue avenue ;'

eng: "The trees seemed to sweep past him in spectral procession, and wild shadows to fling themselves across his path."
fr: 'les arbres semblaient passer devant lui comme une procession spectrale, et des ombres hostiles traversaient non chemin.'

eng: "Once the mare swerved at a white gate-post and nearly threw him."
fr: 'Soudain, la jument broncha devant un poteau de barriere et le desarconna presque.'

eng: "He lashed her across the neck with his crop."
fr: 'Il la cingla a l'encolure de sa cravache.'

eng: "She cleft the dusky air like an arrow."
fr: 'Elle fendit l'air comme une fleche ;'

eng: "The stones flew from her hoofs."
fr: 'les pierres volaient sous ses sabots...'

eng: "At last he reached the Home Farm."
fr: 'Enfin, il atteignit la maison de ferme.'

eng: "Two men were loitering in the yard."
fr: 'Deux hommes causaient dans la cour.'

eng: "He leaped from the saddle and threw the reins to one of them."
fr: 'Il sauta de la selle et remit les renes a l'un d'eux.'

eng: A coarse candle, stuck in a bottle, sputtered beside it.
fr: Une chandelle commune, fichee a cote de lui dans une bouteille, gresillait...

eng: Dorian Gray shuddered.
fr: Dorian Gray frissonna...

eng: He felt that his could not be the hand to take the handkerchief away, and called out to one of the farm-servants to come to him.
fr: Il sentit qu'il ne pourrait pas enlever lui-meme le mouchoir... Il dit a un garcon de ferme de venir.

eng: "Take that thing off the face. I wish to see it," he said, clutching at the door-post for support.
fr: -- Otez cette chose de la figure ; je voudrais la voir, fit-il en s'appuyant au montant de la porte.

eng: He stood there for some minutes looking at the dead body.
fr: Il resta encore quelques instants a considerer le cadavre...

eng: As he rode home, his eyes were full of tears, for he knew he was safe.
fr: Comme il reprenait en galopant le chemin de la maison, ses yeux etaient pleins de larmes, car il se savait la vie sauve...

eng: CHAPTER XIX. "There is no use your telling me that you are going to be good," cried Lord Henry, dipping his white fingers into a red copper bowl filled with rose-water.
fr: Pourquoi me dire que vous voulez devenir bon ? ~~~ s'ecria lord Henry, trempant ses doigts blancs dans un bol de cuivre rouge rempli d'eau de rose.

eng: (No direct equivalent in text)
fr: La feuille de fraisier est l'ornement heraldique, en Angleterre, des couronnes ducales (N. D. ~~~ T.) XIX --

eng: "In the country, Harry. I was staying at a little inn by myself."
fr: "-- A la campagne, Harry... Je demeurais dans une petite auberge."

eng: "My dear boy," said Lord Henry, smiling, "anybody can be good in the country."
fr: "-- Mon cher ami, dit lord Henry en souriant, tout le monde peut etre bon a la campagne ; on n'y trouve point de tentations..."

eng: "There are no temptations there."
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: "That is the reason why people who live out of town are so absolutely uncivilized."
fr: "C'est pourquoi les gens qui vivent hors de la ville sont absolument incivilises ; la civilisation n'est d'aucune maniere, une chose facile a atteindre."

eng: "Civilization is not by any means an easy thing to attain to."
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: "There are only two ways by which man can reach it. One is by being cultured, the other by being corrupt."
fr: "Il n'y a que deux facons d'y arriver : par la culture ou la corruption."

eng: "Country people have no opportunity of being either, so they stagnate."
fr: "Les gens de la campagne n'ont aucune occasion d'atteindre l'une ou l'autre ; aussi stagnent-ils..."

eng: "Culture and corruption," echoed Dorian.
fr: "-- La culture ou la corruption, repeta Dorian..."

eng: "I have known something of both."
fr: "Je les ai un peu connues."

eng: "It seems terrible to me now that they should ever be found together."
fr: "Il me semble terrible, maintenant, que ces deux mots puissent se trouver reunis."

eng: "For I have a new ideal, Harry. I am going to alter."
fr: "Car j'ai un nouvel ideal, Harry. Je veux changer ; je pense que je le suis deja."

eng: "I think I have altered."
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: "You have not yet told me what your good action was. Or did you say you had done more than one?"
fr: "-- Vous ne m'avez pas encore dit quelle etait votre bonne action ; ou bien me disiez-vous que vous en aviez fait plus d'une ?"

eng: "asked his companion as he spilled into his plate a little crimson pyramid of seeded strawberries and, through a perforated, shell-shaped spoon, snowed white sugar upon them."
fr: "demanda son compagnon pendant qu'il versait dans son assiette une petite pyramide cramoisie de fraises aromatiques, et qu'il la neigeait de sucre en poudre au moyen d'une cuiller tamisee en forme de coquille."

eng: It is not a story I could tell to any one else.
fr: Ce n'est pas une histoire que je raconterai a tout le monde...

eng: I spared somebody.
fr: J'ai epargne une femme.

eng: It sounds vain, but you understand what I mean.
fr: Cela semble vain, mais vous comprendrez ce que je veux dire...

eng: Yesterday she met me in a little orchard.
fr: Hier, elle me rencontra dans un petit verger.

eng: The apple-blossoms kept tumbling down on her hair, and she was laughing.
fr: Les fleurs de pommier lui couvraient les cheveux et elle riait.

eng: We were to have gone away together this morning at dawn.
fr: Nous devions partir ensemble ce matin a l'aube...

eng: Suddenly I determined to leave her as flowerlike as I had found her.
fr: Soudainement, je me decidai a la quitter, la laissant fleur comme je l'avais trouvee...

eng: "I should think the novelty of the emotion must have given you a thrill of real pleasure, Dorian," interrupted Lord Henry.
fr: -- J'aime a croire que la nouveaute de l'emotion doit vous avoir donne un frisson de vrai plaisir, Dorian, interrompit lord Henry.

eng: "But I can finish your idyll for you."
fr: Mais je puis finir pour vous votre idylle.

eng: "Harry, you are horrible! You mustn't say these dreadful things."
fr: '-- Harry, vous etes mechant ! Vous ne devriez pas dire ces choses abominables.'

eng: "Hetty's heart is not broken. Of course, she cried and all that."
fr: 'Le coeur d'Hetty n'est pas brise ; elle pleura, cela s'entend, et ce fut tout.'

eng: "But there is no disgrace upon her. She can live, like Perdita, in her garden of mint and marigold."
fr: 'Mais elle n'est point deshonoree ; elle peut vivre, comme Perdita, dans son jardin ou poussent la menthe et le souci.'

eng: I suppose she will be married some day to a rough carter or a grinning ploughman.
fr: Je suppose qu'elle se mariera quelque jour a un rude charretier ou a un paysan grossier ;

eng: Well, the fact of having met you, and loved you, will teach her to despise her husband, and she will be wretched.
fr: le fait de vous avoir rencontre, de vous avoir aime, lui fera detester son mari, et elle sera malheureuse.

eng: From a moral point of view, I cannot say that I think much of your great renunciation.
fr: Au point de vue moral, je ne puis dire que j'augure bien de votre grand renoncement...

eng: Even as a beginning, it is poor.
fr: Pour un debut, c'est pauvre...

eng: Besides, how do you know that Hetty isn't floating at the present moment in some starlit mill-pond, with lovely water-lilies round her, like Ophelia?
fr: En outre savez-vous si le corps d'Hetty ne flotte pas a present dans quelque etang de moulin, eclaire par les etoiles, entoure par des nenuphars, comme Ophelie ?...

eng: I can't bear this, Harry!
fr: -- Je ne veux penser a cela, Harry ?

eng: You mock at everything, and then suggest the most serious tragedies.
fr: Vous vous moquez de tout, et, de cette facon, vous suggerez les tragedies les plus serieuses...

eng: I am sorry I told you now.
fr: Je suis desole de vous en avertir,

eng: I don't care what you say to me.
fr: mais je ne fais plus attention a ce que vous me dites.

eng: I know I was right in acting as I did.
fr: Je sais que j'ai bien fait d'agir ainsi.

eng: Don't let us talk about it any more, and don't try to persuade me that the first good action I have done for years, the first little bit of self-sacrifice I have ever known, is really a sort of sin.
fr: Ne parlons plus de cela, et n'essayez pas de me persuader que la premiere bonne action que j'aie faite depuis des annees, le premier petit sacrifice de moi-meme que je me connaisse, soit une sorte de peche.

eng: I want to be better.
fr: J'ai besoin d'etre meilleur.

eng: I am going to be better.
fr: Je deviens meilleur...

eng: Tell me something about yourself.
fr: Parlez-moi de vous.

eng: What is going on in town?
fr: Que dit-on a la ville ?

eng: "My dear boy, they have only been talking about it for six weeks, and the British public are really not equal to the mental strain of having more than one topic every three months."
fr: "-- Mon cher ami, on n'a parle de cela que pendant six semaines, et le public anglais n'a pas la force de supporter plus d'un sujet de conversation tous les trois mois."

eng: "They have been very fortunate lately, however."
fr: "Il a ete cependant assez bien partage, recemment :"

eng: "They have had my own divorce-case and Alan Campbell's suicide."
fr: "il y a eu mon propre divorce, et le suicide d'Alan Campbell ;"

eng: "Now they have got the mysterious disappearance of an artist."
fr: "a present, c'est la disparition mysterieuse d'un artiste."

eng: "Scotland Yard still insists that the man in the grey ulster who left for Paris by the midnight train on the ninth of November was poor Basil, and the French police declare that Basil never arrived in Paris at all."
fr: "On croit a Scotland-Yard que l'homme a l'ulster gris qui quitta Londres pour Paris, le neuf novembre, par le train de minuit, etait ce pauvre Basil, et la police francaise declare que Basil n'est jamais venu a Paris."

eng: "I suppose in about a fortnight we shall be told that he has been seen in San Francisco."
fr: "J'aime a penser que dans une quinzaine, nous apprendrons qu'on l'a vu a San-Francisco."

eng: "It is an odd thing, but every one who disappears is said to be seen at San Francisco."
fr: "C'est une chose bizarre, mais on voit a San-Francisco toutes les personnes qu'on croit disparues."

eng: "It must be a delightful city, and possess all the attractions of the next world."
fr: "Ce doit etre une ville delicieuse ; elle possede toutes les attractions du monde futur..."

eng: "What do you think has happened to Basil?"
fr: "-- Que pensez-vous qu'il soit arrive a Basil ?"

eng: If Basil chooses to hide himself, it is no business of mine.
fr: Si Basil veut se cacher, ce n'est point la mon affaire.

eng: If he is dead, I don't want to think about him.
fr: S'il est mort... je n'ai pas besoin d'y penser.

eng: Death is the only thing that ever terrifies me.
fr: La mort est la seule chose qui m'ait jamais terrifie.

eng: Death and vulgarity are the only two facts in the nineteenth century that one cannot explain away.
fr: La mort et la vulgarite sont les deux seules choses au dix-neuvieme siecle que l'on ne peut expliquer...

eng: Let us have our coffee in the music-room, Dorian.
fr: Allons prendre le cafe dans le salon, Dorian.

eng: You must play Chopin to me.
fr: Vous me jouerez du Chopin.

eng: The man with whom my wife ran away played Chopin exquisitely.
fr: Le gentleman avec qui ma femme est partie interpretait Chopin d'une maniere exquise...

eng: Poor Victoria!
fr: Pauvre Victoria !...

eng: I was very fond of her.
fr: Je l'aimais beaucoup ;

eng: The house is rather lonely without her.
fr: la maison est un peu triste sans elle.

eng: Of course, married life is merely a habit, a bad habit.
fr: La vie conjugale est simplement une habitude, une mauvaise habitude.

eng: But then one regrets the loss even of one's worst habits.
fr: Mais on regrette meme la perte de ses mauvaises habitudes ;

eng: Perhaps one regrets them the most.
fr: peut etre est-ce celles-la que l'on regrette le plus ;

eng: They are such an essential part of one's personality.
fr: elles sont une partie essentielle de la personnalite.

eng: "After the coffee had been brought in, he stopped, and looking over at Lord Henry, said, "Harry, did it ever occur to you that Basil was murdered?"
fr: 'Quand on apporta le cafe, il s'arreta, et regardant lord Henry, lui dit : -- Harry, ne vous est-il jamais, venu a l'idee que Basil avait ete assassine ?'

eng: "Basil was very popular, and always wore a Waterbury watch."
fr: 'Basil etait tres connu et portait toujours une montre Waterbury...'

eng: "Why should he have been murdered?"
fr: 'Pourquoi l'aurait-on assassine ?'

eng: "He was not clever enough to have enemies."
fr: 'Il n'etait pas assez habile pour avoir des ennemis ;'

eng: "Of course, he had a wonderful genius for painting."
fr: 'je ne parle pas de son merveilleux talent de peintre ;'

eng: "But a man can paint like Velasquez and yet be as dull as possible."
fr: 'mais un homme peut peindre comme Velasquez et etre aussi terne que possible.'

eng: "But don't people say that he was murdered?"
fr: 'Mais ne dit-on pas qu'il a ete assassine ?'

eng: "Oh, some of the papers do."
fr: 'Oui, quelques journaux...'

eng: "It does not seem to me to be at all probable."
fr: 'Cela ne me semble guere probable.'

eng: "What would you say, Harry, if I told you that I had murdered Basil?" said the younger man.
fr: '-- Que diriez-vous, Harry, si je vous disais que j'ai assassine Basil ? dit Dorian en l'observant attentivement pendant qu'il parlait.'

eng: He watched him intently after he had spoken.
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: "I would say, my dear fellow, that you were posing for a character that doesn't suit you."
fr: '-- Je vous dirais, mon cher ami, que vous posez pour un caractere qui ne vous va pas.'

eng: But let us pass from poor Basil.
fr: Mais ne parlons plus du pauvre Basil.

eng: I wish I could believe that he had come to such a really romantic end as you suggest, but I can't.
fr: Je voudrais croire qu'il a pu avoir une fin aussi romantique que celle que vous supposez ; mais je ne puis...

eng: I dare say he fell into the Seine off an omnibus and that the conductor hushed up the scandal.
fr: Il a du tomber d'un omnibus dans la Seine, et le conducteur n'en a point parle...

eng: Yes: I should fancy that was his end.
fr: Oui, telle a ete probablement sa fin...

eng: "During the last ten years his painting had gone off very much."
fr: "Pendant les dix dernieres annees, sa peinture s'en allait beaucoup."

eng: "Dorian heaved a sigh, and Lord Henry strolled across the room and began to stroke the head of a curious Java parrot, a large, grey-plumaged bird with pink crest and tail, that was balancing itself upon a bamboo perch."
fr: "Dorian poussa un soupir, et lord Henry traversant la chambre, alla chatouiller la tete d'un curieux perroquet de Java, un gros oiseau au plumage gris, a la crete et a la queue vertes, qui se balancait sur un bambou."

eng: "As his pointed fingers touched it, it dropped the white scurf of crinkled lids over black, glasslike eyes and began to sway backwards and forwards."
fr: "Comme ses doigts effiles le touchaient, il fit se mouvoir la dartre blanche de ses paupieres clignotantes sur ses prunelles semblables a du verre noir et commenca a se dandiner en avant et en arriere."

eng: It seemed to me to have lost something.
fr: Il me semblait avoir perdu quelque chose.

eng: It had lost an ideal.
fr: Il avait perdu un ideal.

eng: When you and he ceased to be great friends, he ceased to be a great artist.
fr: Quand vous et lui cesserent d'etre grands amis, il cessa d'etre un grand artiste.

eng: What was it separated you?
fr: Qu'est-ce qui vous separa ?...

eng: I suppose he bored you.
fr: Je crois qu'il vous ennuyait.

eng: If so, he never forgave you.
fr: Si cela fut, il ne vous oublia jamais.

eng: It's a habit bores have.
fr: C'est une habitude qu'ont tous les facheux.

eng: By the way, what has become of that wonderful portrait he did of you?
fr: A propos qu'est donc devenu cet admirable portrait qu'il avait peint d'apres vous ?

eng: I don't think I have ever seen it since he finished it.
fr: Je crois ne point l'avoir revu depuis qu'il y mit la derniere main.

eng: Oh!
fr: Ah !

eng: I remember I wanted to buy it.
fr: Je me souviens que je voulais l'acheter.

eng: I wish I had now.
fr: Je voudrais l'avoir achete maintenant.

eng: It belonged to Basil's best period.
fr: Il appartenait a la meilleure epoque de Basil.

eng: Did you advertise for it? You should.
fr: Avez-vous mis des annonces pour le retrouver ? Vous auriez du en mettre.

eng: "I forget," said Dorian.
fr: -- Je ne me souviens plus, dit Dorian.

eng: "I suppose I did.
fr: Je crois que oui.

eng: But I never really liked it.
fr: Mais je ne l'ai jamais aime.

eng: I am sorry I sat for it.
fr: Je regrette d'avoir pose pour ce portrait.

eng: The memory of the thing is hateful to me.
fr: Le souvenir de tout cela m'est odieux.

eng: Why do you talk of it?
fr: Il me remet toujours en memoire ces vers d'une piece connue, Hamlet, je crois...

eng: It used to remind me of those curious lines in some play Hamlet, I think how do they run?
fr: ~~~ Voyons, que disent-ils ?...

eng: I was going through the park last Sunday, and close by the Marble Arch there stood a little crowd of shabby-looking people listening to some vulgar street-preacher.
fr: J'etais au Parc dimanche dernier et pres de l'Arche de Marbre se trouvait un rassemblement de gens mal vetus qui ecoutaient quelque vulgaire predicateur de carrefour.

eng: As I passed by, I heard the man yelling out that question to his audience.
fr: Au moment ou je passais, j'entendis cet homme proposant cette question a son auditoire.

eng: It struck me as being rather dramatic.
fr: Elle me frappa comme etant assez dramatique.

eng: London is very rich in curious effects of that kind.
fr: Londres est riche en incidents de ce genre.

eng: A wet Sunday, an uncouth Christian in a mackintosh, a ring of sickly white faces under a broken roof of dripping umbrellas, and a wonderful phrase flung into the air by shrill hysterical lips it was really very good in its way, quite a suggestion.
fr: << Un dimanche humide, un chretien bizarre en mackintosh, un cercle de figures blanches et maladives sous un toit inegal de parapluies ruisselants, une phrase merveilleuse jete au vent comme un cri par des levres hysteriques, tout cela etait la une chose vraiment belle dans son genre, et tout a fait suggestive.

eng: "I am afraid, however, he would not have understood me."
fr: "Je crains, cependant, qu'il ne m'eut point compris."

eng: "Don't, Harry. The soul is a terrible reality."
fr: "Non, Harry. L'ame est une terrible realite."

eng: That is the fatality of faith, and the lesson of romance.
fr: C'est la fatalite de la Foi et la lecon du Roman.

eng: How grave you are!
fr: Comme vous etes grave !

eng: Don't be so serious.
fr: Ne soyez pas aussi serieux.

eng: You have never looked more charming than you do to-night.
fr: Vous n'avez jamais ete plus charmant a voir que ce soir.

eng: You remind me of the day I saw you first.
fr: Vous me rappelez le premier jour que je vous ai vu.

eng: You were rather cheeky, very shy, and absolutely extraordinary.
fr: Vous etiez un peu plus joufflu et timide, tout a fait extraordinaire.

eng: You have changed, of course, but not in appearance.
fr: Vous avez change, certes, mais pas en apparence.

eng: The only people to whose opinions I listen now with any respect are people much younger than myself.
fr: Les seuls hommes dont j'ecoute les opinions avec respect sont ceux qui sont plus jeunes que moi.

eng: They seem in front of me.
fr: Ils me paraissent marcher devant moi.

eng: Life has revealed to them her latest wonder.
fr: La vie leur a revele ses dernieres merveilles.

eng: Don't spoil it by renunciations.
fr: Ne le gatez par aucun renoncement.

eng: At present you are a perfect type.
fr: Vous etes a present un etre accompli.

eng: Don't make yourself incomplete.
fr: Ne vous rendez pas incomplet.

eng: 'Life has been your art. You have set yourself to music. Your days are your sonnets.'
fr: 'Votre art, ce fut votre vie. Vous vous etes mis vous-meme en musique. Vos jours sont vos sonnets.'

eng: "Yes, life has been exquisite," he murmured
fr: "-- Oui, murmura-t-il, la vie me fut exquise..."

eng: "but I am not going to have the same life, Harry."
fr: "Mais je ne veux plus vivre cette meme vie, Harry."

eng: "And you must not say these extravagant things to me."
fr: "Et vous ne devriez pas me dire ces choses extravagantes."

eng: "You don't know everything about me."
fr: "Vous ne me connaissez pas tout entier."

eng: "I think that if you did, even you would turn from me."
fr: "Si vous saviez tout, je crois bien que vous vous eloigneriez de moi."

eng: "You laugh. Don't laugh."
fr: "Vous riez ? Ne riez pas..."

eng: "Why have you stopped playing, Dorian?"
fr: "Pourquoi vous arretez-vous de jouer, Dorian ?"

eng: "Go back and give me the nocturne over again."
fr: "Remettez-vous au piano et jouez-moi encore ce Nocturne."

eng: "Look at that great, honey-coloured moon that hangs in the dusky air."
fr: "Voyez cette large lune couleur de miel qui monte dans le ciel sombre."

eng: Dorian rose up from the piano and passed his hand through his hair.
fr: Dorian se leva du piano et passant la main dans sa chevelure :

eng: Let us go to the club, then.
fr: Allons au club, alors.

eng: It has been a charming evening, and we must end it charmingly.
fr: La soiree a ete charmante, il faut bien la terminer.

eng: There is some one at White s who wants immensely to know you young Lord Poole, Bournemouth s eldest son.
fr: Il y a quelqu'un au White qui desire infiniment faire votre connaissance : le jeune lord Pool, l'aine des fils de Bournemouth.

eng: "He is quite delightful and rather reminds me of you."
fr: 'Il est tout a fait charmant, et me fait presque songer a vous.'

eng: "I hope not," said Dorian with a sad look in his eyes.
fr: 'J'espere que non, dit Dorian avec un regard triste,'

eng: "But I am tired to-night, Harry. I shan't go to the club."
fr: 'mais je me sens fatigue ce soir, Harry ; je n'irai pas club.'

eng: "It is nearly eleven, and I want to go to bed early."
fr: 'Il est pres de onze heures, et je desire me coucher de bonne heure.'

eng: There was something in your touch that was wonderful.
fr: Il y avait dans votre facon de jouer quelque chose de merveilleux.

eng: It had more expression than I had ever heard from it before.
fr: C'etait d'un sentiment que je n'avais encore jamais entendu.

eng: "It is because I am going to be good," he answered, smiling.
fr: C'est parce que je vais devenir bon, repondit-il en souriant.

eng: "I am a little changed already."
fr: Je suis deja un peu change.

eng: "You cannot change to me, Dorian," said Lord Henry.
fr: Vous ne pouvez changer avec moi, Dorian, dit lord Henry.

eng: "You and I will always be friends."
fr: Nous serons toujours deux amis.

eng: "Yet you poisoned me with a book once.
fr: Pourtant, vous m'avez un jour empoisonne avec un livre.

eng: I should not forgive that.
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: Harry, promise me that you will never lend that book to any one.
fr: Harry, promets-moi de ne plus jamais preter ce livre a personne.

eng: It does harm.
fr: Il est malfaisant.

eng: Besides, it is no use.
fr: D'ailleurs, ca ne sert a rien.

eng: You and I are what we are, and will be what we will be.
fr: Nous sommes ce que nous sommes et serons ce que nous pourrons.

eng: As for being poisoned by a book, there is no such thing as that.
fr: Quant a etre empoisonne par un livre, on ne vit jamais rien de pareil.

eng: She is a charming woman, and wants to consult you about some tapestries she is thinking of buying.
fr: C'est une femme charmante, elle desire vous consulter sur une tapisserie qu'elle voudrait acheter.

eng: Mind you come.
fr: Pensez-vous venir ?

eng: Or shall we lunch with our little duchess?
fr: Ou bien dejeunerons-nous avec notre petite duchesse ?

eng: Perhaps you are tired of Gladys?
fr: Peut-etre etes-vous fatigue de Gladys ?

eng: I thought you would be.
fr: Je le pensais.

eng: Her clever tongue gets on one's nerves.
fr: Sa maniere d'esprit vous donne sur les nerfs...

eng: As he reached the door, he hesitated for a moment, as if he had something more to say.
fr: Arrive a la porte, il hesita un moment comme s'il eut eu encore quelque chose a dire.

eng: Then he sighed and went out.
fr: Puis il soupira et sortit...

eng: CHAPTER XX.
fr: XX

eng: It was a lovely night, so warm that he threw his coat over his arm and did not even put his silk scarf round his throat.
fr: Il faisait une nuit delicieuse, si douce, qu'il jeta son pardessus sur son bras, et ne mit meme pas son foulard autour de son cou.

eng: Comme la peinture d'un chagrin Une figure sans coeur. (No direct equivalent in text)
fr: Comme la peinture d'un chagrin Une figure sans coeur.

eng: He felt a wild longing for the unstained purity of his boyhood his rose-white boyhood, as Lord Henry had once called it.
fr: Il se sentit un ardent et sauvage desir pour la purete sans tache de son adolescence, son adolescence rose et blanche, comme lord Henry l'avait une fois appelee.

eng: He knew that he had tarnished himself, filled his mind with corruption and given horror to his fancy;
fr: Il se rendait compte qu'il avait terni son ame, corrompu son esprit, et qu'il s'etait cree d'horribles remords ;

eng: that he had been an evil influence to others, and had experienced a terrible joy in being so;
fr: qu'il avait eu sur les autres une desastreuse influence, et qu'il y avait trouve une mauvaise joie ;

eng: and that of the lives that had crossed his own, it had been the fairest and the most full of promise that he had brought to shame.
fr: que de toutes les vies qui avaient traverse la sienne et qu'il avait souillees, la sienne etait encore la plus belle et la plus remplie de promesses...

eng: But was it all irretrievable?
fr: Tout cela etait-il irreparable ?

eng: His beauty had been to him but a mask, his youth but a mockery.
fr: Sa beaute ne lui avait ete qu'un masque, sa jeunesse qu'une raillerie.

eng: What was youth at best?
fr: Qu'etait la jeunesse d'ailleurs ?

eng: A green, an unripe time, a time of shallow moods, and sickly thoughts.
fr: Un instant vert et premature, un temps d'humeurs futiles, de pensees maladives...

eng: Why had he worn its livery?
fr: Pourquoi avait-il voulu porter sa livree...

eng: Nor, indeed, was it the death of Basil Hallward that weighed most upon his mind.
fr: Ce n'etait pas, en verite, la mort de Basil Hallward qui l'oppressait ;

eng: It was the living death of his own soul that troubled him.
fr: c'etait la mort vivante de son ame.

eng: Basil had painted the portrait that had marred his life.
fr: Basil avait peint le portrait qui avait gate sa vie ;

eng: He could not forgive him that.
fr: il ne pouvait pardonner cela :

eng: It was the portrait that had done everything.
fr: c'etait le portrait qui avait tout fait...

eng: Basil had said things to him that were unbearable, and that he had yet borne with patience.
fr: Basil lui avait dit des choses vraiment insupportables qu'il avait d'abord ecoutees avec patience.

eng: As for Alan Campbell, his suicide had been his own act.
fr: Quant a Alan Campbell, s'il s'etait suicide, c'est qu'il l'avait bien voulu...

eng: He had chosen to do it.
fr: Il n'en etait pas responsable.

eng: It was nothing to him.
fr: (No direct equivalent in text)

eng: A new life! That was what he wanted. That was what he was waiting for.
fr: Une vie nouvelle !... Voila ce qu'il desirait ; voila ce qu'il attendait...

eng: Surely he had begun it already.
fr: Surement elle avait deja commence !

eng: He had spared one innocent thing, at any rate.
fr: Il venait d'epargner un etre innocent, il ne tenterait jamais plus l'innocence ; il serait bon...

eng: He would never again tempt innocence. He would be good.
fr: (Already aligned above)

eng: As he thought of Hetty Merton, he began to wonder if the portrait in the locked room had changed.
fr: Comme il pensait a Hetty Merton, il se demanda si le portrait de la chambre fermee n'avait pas change.

eng: Surely it was not still so horrible as it had been?
fr: Surement il ne pouvait etre aussi epouvantable qu'il l'avait ete ?

eng: It seemed to have crept like a horrible disease over the wrinkled fingers.
fr: Elle semblait s'etre elargie comme la plaie d'une horrible maladie sur les doigts rides !...

eng: There was blood on the painted feet, as though the thing had dripped blood even on the hand that had not held the knife.
fr: Il y avait du sang sur les pieds du portrait comme si le sang avait degoutte, sur eux ! Meme il y avait du sang sur la main qui n'avait pas tenu le couteau !...

eng: Confess? Did it mean that he was to confess?
fr: Confesser son crime ? Savait-il ce que cela voulait dire, se confesser ?

eng: To give himself up and be put to death?
fr: C'etait se livrer, et se livrer lui-meme a la mort !

eng: He laughed.
fr: Il se mit a rire...

eng: He felt that the idea was monstrous.
fr: Cette idee etait monstrueuse...

eng: Besides, even if he did confess, who would believe him?
fr: D'ailleurs, s'il se confessait, qui le croirait ?

eng: There was no trace of the murdered man anywhere.
fr: Il n'existait nulle trace de l'homme assassine ;

eng: Everything belonging to him had been destroyed.
fr: tout ce qui lui avait appartenu etait detruit ;

eng: He himself had burned what had been below-stairs.
fr: lui-meme l'avait brule...

eng: The world would simply say that he was mad.
fr: Le monde dirait simplement qu'il devenait fou...'

eng: Yet it was his duty to confess, to suffer public shame, and to make public atonement.
fr: Cependant son devoir etait de se confesser, de souffrir la honte devant tous, et de faire une expiation publique...

eng: There was a God who called upon men to tell their sins to earth as well as to heaven.
fr: Il y avait un Dieu qui forcait les hommes a dire leurs peches sur cette terre aussi bien que dans le ciel.

eng: Nothing that he could do would cleanse him till he had told his own sin.
fr: Quoi qu'il fit, rien ne pourrait le purifier jusqu'a ce qu'il eut avoue son crime...

eng: His sin?
fr: Son crime !...

eng: He shrugged his shoulders.
fr: Il haussa les epaules.

eng: The death of Basil Hallward seemed very little to him.
fr: La vie de Basil Hallward lui importait peu ;

eng: He was thinking of Hetty Merton.
fr: il pensait a Hetty Merton...

eng: For it was an unjust mirror, this mirror of his soul that he was looking at.
fr: Car c'etait un miroir injuste, ce miroir de son ame qu'il contemplait...

eng: Vanity?
fr: Vanite ?

eng: At least he thought so.
fr: Il le pensait au moins.

eng: But who could tell?
fr: Mais qui pouvait le dire ?

eng: No. There had been nothing more.
fr: Non, il n'y avait rien de plus...

eng: Through vanity he had spared her.
fr: Par vanite, il l'avait epargnee ;

eng: In hypocrisy he had worn the mask of goodness.
fr: par hypocrisie, il avait porte le masque de la bonte ;

eng: For curiosity's sake he had tried the denial of self.
fr: par curiosite, il avait essaye du renoncement...

eng: He recognized that now.
fr: Il le reconnaissait maintenant.

eng: But this murder was it to dog him all his life?
fr: Mais ce meurtre le poursuivrait-il toute sa vie ?

eng: It had kept him awake at night.
fr: Il le tenait eveille la nuit...

eng: When he had been away, he had been filled with terror lest other eyes should look upon it.
fr: Quand il partait de chez lui, il etait rempli de la terreur que d'autres yeux que les siens puissent le voir.

eng: It had brought melancholy across his passions.
fr: Il avait apporte une tristesse melancolique sur ses passions.

eng: It had been like conscience to him.
fr: Il lui avait ete comme une conscience.

eng: Yes, it had been conscience.
fr: Oui, il avait ete la Conscience...

eng: He would destroy it.
fr: Il le detruirait !...

eng: He had cleaned it many times, till there was no stain left upon it.
fr: Il l'avait nettoye bien des fois, jusqu'a ce qu'il ne fut plus tache.

eng: It was bright, and glistened.
fr: Il brillait...

eng: As it had killed the painter, so it would kill the painter's work, and all that that meant.
fr: Comme il avait tue le peintre, il tuerait l'oeuvre du peintre, et tout ce qu'elle signifiait...

eng: It would kill the past, and when that was dead, he would be free.
fr: Il tuerait le passe, et quand ce passe serait mort, il serait libre !...

eng: It would kill this monstrous soul-life, and without its hideous warnings, he would be at peace.
fr: Il tuerait le monstrueux portrait de son ame, et prive de ses hideux avertissements, il recouvrerait la paix.

eng: He seized the thing, and stabbed the picture with it.
fr: Il saisit le couteau, et en frappa le tableau !...

eng: There was a cry heard, and a crash.
fr: Il y eut un grand cri, et une chute...

eng: asked the elder of the two gentlemen.
fr: demanda le plus age des deux gentlemen.

eng: "Mr. Dorian Gray sir," answered the policeman.
fr: -- A M. Dorian Gray, Monsieur, repondit le policeman.

eng: They looked at each other, as they walked away, and sneered.
fr: En s'en allant, ils se regarderent l'un l'autre et ricanerent :

eng: One of them was Sir Henry Ashton's uncle.
fr: l'un d'eux etait l'oncle de sir Henry Ashton...

eng: Inside, in the servants' part of the house, the half-clad domestics were talking in low whispers to each other.
fr: Dans les communs de la maison, les domestiques a moitie habilles, se parlaient a voix basse ;

eng: Old Mrs. Leaf was crying and wringing her hands.
fr: la vieille Mistress Leaf sanglotait en se tordant les mains ;

eng: Francis was as pale as death.
fr: Francis etait pale comme un mort.

eng: After about a quarter of an hour, he got the coachman and one of the footmen and crept upstairs.
fr: Au bout d'un quart d'heure, il monta dans la chambre, avec le cocher et un des laquais.

eng: They knocked, but there was no reply.
fr: Ils frapperent sans qu'on leur repondit.

eng: The windows yielded easily; their bolts were old.
fr: Les fenetres cederent aisement ; leurs ferrures etaient vieilles...

eng: When they entered, they found hanging upon the wall a splendid portrait of their master as they had last seen him, in all the wonder of his exquisite youth and beauty.
fr: Quand ils entrerent, ils trouverent, pendu au mur, un splendide portrait de leur maitre tel qu'ils l'avaient toujours connu, dans toute la splendeur de son exquise jeunesse et de sa beaute.

eng: Lying on the floor was a dead man, in evening dress, with a knife in his heart.
fr: Gisant sur le plancher, etait un homme mort, en habit de soiree, un poignard au coeur !...

eng: It was not till they had examined the rings that they recognized who it was.
fr: Ce ne fut qu'a ses bagues qu'ils purent reconnaitre qui il etait...

eng: THE END
fr: FIN
